section.title: Balances and Transactions
section.para: The Balances and Transactions menu options allow the user to inquire on account balances and existing transactions in the .

section.title: Balances and Transactions - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Balances and Transactions functions, from the tool bar, select Account Services > Balances and Transactions.

section.title: Balances and Transactions - Functions
section.para: When the Balances and Transactions option is selected from the Account Services menu on the toolbar, a navigation menu on the left hand side of the page, provides a list of related functions that are available.
This menu provides a number of functions, as follows:

listitem.para: Display a list of transactions available for your action.
Search for specific transaction notifications within the .
Search for specific pending transactions within the .
Search for specific transactions within the .
Create Transactions Batches in the Portal.
Inquire on Batch processes in the Portal.
Inquire on all in the Portal.
View advices and notifications from the bank.
View list of tasks in the Portal.
Specify information criteria and download reports.
Execute specific reports.

section.title: Pending List
section.para: This function displays a list of transactions that have been created but not yet submitted due to insufficient authorisation authority, that the user is authorised to submit. In many cases, it is necessary for a user, other than the creator, to submit a transaction, due to financial limits or process guidelines.

section.title: Pending List - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Pending List from the toolbar, the Pending List function can be selected from the left side navigation menu. Clicking on the Pending link from the Banner is another option to open this screen.

section.title: Pending List Selection
section.para: When the Pending List function is selected, the system provides an easy method for the user to identify and display transactions they are authorised to submit, and in some cases will be required to submit.
Click the Search Options link to display a list of search criteria, the list can be filtered by. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

section.title: Batch Initiation
section.para: When a transaction has been created, it will usually require another user to authorise it before it can be submitted. In some companies, the authorisation process will require an OTP (One Time Password) token to be added each time an authorisation is performed. This function provides the facility to group multiple transactions that require authorisation, into a batch that can be authorised in a single action, as a group. This facility can significantly reduce workload and processing time, when large numbers of transactions need to be authorised. Only transactions that have not been authorised can be included in a batch, and batches are in effect until the batch is submitted.

section.title: Batch Initiation - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Balances and Transactions from the toolbar, the Batch Initiation function can be selected from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Batch Initiation Selection
section.para: When the Batch Initiation function is selected, the system will display a list of transactions waiting to be authorised.

Click on the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Account Number, Product, Product Type, Status, Customer Ref, File Ref/CO no, Ccy, Account From, or Counterparty fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Batch processes are the following:

Click on the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Batch ID, Batch Date, or Batch Maker fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The columns returned in the list of Batch processes are the following:

section.title: Authorising and Submitting Batches
section.para: To authorise or submit a batch of transactions, click the batch id in the batch list shown by the Batch inquiry function. This will cause the system to display the Batch Info screen.

This screen will display the current status of the batch, including any previous authorisations, and allow it to be authorised (both with an E-sign request or Proxy authorisation) and if appropriate, submitted using the buttons on the bottom right corner.

section.condition: TITLE=Balances and Transactions: Advices and Notification
section.title: Advices and Notification
section.para: This function allows the user to view advices and notifications that have been received from the Bank. These are files that have been loaded by the bank and are directed at specific clients, relating to the clients business, accounts or in some cases, existing transactions. In most cases, these notifications do not require any response or action from the customer.

section.title: Advices and Notification - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Balances and Transactions from the toolbar, the Advices and Notification function can be selected from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Advices and Notifications Selection
section.para: When the Advices and Notification function is selected, the system will display a list of notifications that have received from the Bank.

Click on the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Advices Type, Account Number, Bank Ref. or Date from and To fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
The columns returned in the list of notifications are the following:

entry.para: Field
Description
Unique reference number generated by for this batch run.
The Entity the advice is directed to.
The Type of advice. (Trade Services or Remittance)
The number of the account associated with the advice.
The topic of the advice.
The reference number used by the Bank to identify this advice.
The date the advice was sent.
The first E-Signature.

section.para: Once displayed, transactions can be viewed or edited using the Icons to the left of each entry.

section.title: Tasks Monitoring
section.para: This function allows the user to view a full list of tasks (depending on search criteria). When you select this option, you are presented with a list of tasks and comments.

section.title: Tasks Monitoring - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Balances and Transactions from the toolbar, the Tasks Monitoring function can be selected from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Tasks Monitoring Selection
section.para: You can select which entries are shown, by entering search criteria in the Task Type, Post Date (From and To), System Id, Task Status, and/or Item Type fields. Initially all these fields are blank except that the date fields are set to today's date, so you see all tasks and comments created today.
You can leave the From and/or To fields blank.
You can use wildcards in the System Id field. For example, *5885 will match all system IDs that end in 5885. The comparison is not case sensitive.
If you include comments in the display, only comments attached to tasks of the type and status selected are included.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
The list has the following columns:

entry.para: Field
Description
Checkbox showing whether the task has been completed.
For comments, this column is always empty since no status is attached to a comment.
The type of the item:

section.title: Download Reports
section.para: This function allows the user to download customised reports that are produced independently by the Bank. These reports are not necessarily related to the portal, and will only be available when prior arrangements have been made with the Bank.

section.title: Download Reports - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Balances and Transactions from the toolbar, the Download Reports function can be selected from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Download Reports Selection
section.para: When the Download Reports function is selected, the system will display a list of reports that have created and made available by the Bank.

Click on the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, Report Type, Report Sub Type, Account Number, or Dates From and To fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. The columns returned in the list of reports are the following:

section.title: Report Execution
section.para: Standard reports can be created by the Bank or other authorised users within the company, using the Report Designer function. The Report Execution function allows users to execute those reports.

section.title: Report Execution - Navigation
section.para: After selecting Account Services > Balances and Transactions from the toolbar, the Report Execution function can be selected from the left side navigation menu.

section.title: Report Execution Selection
section.para: When the Report Execution function is selected, a list of previously created reports and their descriptions, is displayed and can be scrolled through to find the required report. Alternatively, the report name can be entered in the search criteria fields.
To execute the report, click on the report name. Depending on the report setup, some reports may require extra parameters to be entered when executed.
There is also a download button that allows the results to be saved as a file on the executing PC. Click this button and select the required option from the list shown. The options are:

listitem.para: CSV downloads the list to the PC as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the list to the PC as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: Use the CSV or SpreadSheet option to export the list as a report allowing it to be customized further for various office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, save the file (default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it to launch Excel if it is available on the workstation.
